name: A. Crossmarket
statement:
Stanley and Megan decided to shop in the "Crossmarket" grocery store,
which can be represented as a matrix with n rows and m columns. Stanley
and Megan can move to an adjacent cell using 1 unit of power. Two cells
are considered adjacent if they share an edge. To speed up the shopping
process, Megan brought her portals with her, and she leaves one in each
cell she visits (if there is no portal yet). If a person (Stanley or
Megan) is in a cell with a portal, that person can use 1 unit of power
to teleport to any other cell with a portal, including Megan’s starting
cell.They decided to split up: Stanley will go from the upper-left cell
(cell with coordinates (1, 1)) to the lower-right cell (cell with
coordinates (n, m)), whilst Megan needs to get from the lower-left cell
(cell with coordinates (n, 1)) to the upper-right cell (cell with
coordinates (1, m)).What is the minimum total energy needed for them
both to do that?Note that they can choose the time they move. Time does
not affect energy.
